FuncDef:
The adm card description command configures descriptions for the channels and optical fiber interfaces on an Add/Drop Multiplexer (ADM).
The undo adm card description command restores the default configuration.
By default, no description is configured for the channels and optical fiber interfaces on an ADM.
CLIs: undo adm slot <slot-id> card <card-id> channel <channel-id> description
undo adm slot <slot-id> card <card-id> lineport <lineport-id> description

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an available subcard.
-

Specifies the ID of an available channel.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 8.

Port description.
The value is a string of 1 to 242 case-sensitive characters, with spaces supported.

Specifies the port number of an available line.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 8.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] adm slot 1 card 0 channel 2 description channel-2
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When you use an ADM, run the adm card description command to configure descriptions for the channels and optical fiber interfaces. Additionally, the command output also contains subcard IDs, which facilitates user management.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
